data.title: Cheryl's transformation over the years as the Girls Aloud tour ends
data.meta_description: An extensive look at how Cheryl's look has changed over the years, from her time in Girls Aloud in 2002, all the way to the Girls Aloud tour, as she turns 41-years-old.
data.text:
She's had plenty of different looks!

Although she's kept herself out of the spotlight in recent years, Cheryl made a comeback to showbiz in 2023, making her West End debut in play 2:22 A Ghost Story, which she received amazing reviews for. After starting out her career in girl band Girls Aloud when the group were formed on Popstars: The Rival in 2002, Cheryl went on to enjoy an extensive career, in the band, as a solo artist and even as a TV talent judge on The X Factor and The Greatest Dancer.

Throughout her career, Cheryl has had some incredible looks - from her time in Girls Aloud, to her Cheryl Tweedy/Cole years, to the time of Fernandez-Versini, right through till now. As Cheryl has now finished the tour with Girls Aloud in May and June 2024, we've decided to take an extensive look at her different looks throughout the years.

Check out Cheryl throughout the years below:

Cheryl, along with Nadine Coyle, Nicola Roberts and Kimberley Walsh, delighted fans last year by announcing they were reuniting for a 2024 tour across the UK!

In memory of the late Sarah Harding, Girls Aloud start their tour in Dublin in May, before playing dates in the likes of Belfast, Manchester, Cardiff, Newcastle, Aberdeen, Glasgow, Nottingham, Leeds, Birmingham, Liverpool and London.
